result.execSummary:
The defendant Serena A Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Serena A Kelley in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 and to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

Conditions of Probation:
- 5 months condition time with release to the day reporting center. Court objects to electronic monitoring. Court stayed commencement until 07/17/2015 at 12:00pm.
- No new law violations.
- Cooperate with the agent.
- Mental Health evaluation, follow-up care, and treatment if deemed appropriate.
- Take any and all medication only as prescribed and in the proper dosage.
- Anger management classes if deemed appropriate.
- Cognitive thinking classes if deemed appropriate.
- No contact with the victim as specified in the Complaint.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Costs to be paid during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges; 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied; if there is a remaining balance, it is to be returned to the remitter.  

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form
AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

Defendant Serena A Kelley in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Amended Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  

Charge amended to:

COUNT 1:  MISDEMEANOR BATTERY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor
COUNT 2:  DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statues section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS COUNTS 1 AND 2 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Serena A Kelley in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  Defense no longer in a contest posture; plea forms submitted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Serena A Kelley in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  The Court orders stayed warrant withdrawn at this time.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 4-01-15 at 9:00 a.m.

Attorney Richard J. Smith in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Defense motion to adjourn heard and granted by the Court (medically related).  The state has no objection as the state was advised of this request last month.  The Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued but stayed.  New dates selected with the parties.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
